Heading: WCO Harmonized System
Note: World Customs Organization Harmonized Commodity Coding and Description System. Use 6 (or occasionally 8 or 10) digits, without punctuation

Heading: UNSPSC
Note: UN Standard Product and Service Classification. Use 8 (or occasionally 10) digits, without punctuation

Heading: HMRC
Note: UK Revenue and Customs classifications, based on the Harmonized System

Heading: Warenverzeichnis für die Außenhandelsstatistik
Note: German export trade classification, based on the Harmonised System

Heading: TARIC
Note: EU TARIC codes, an extended version of the Harmonized System. Use 10 digits, without punctuation

Heading: Fondsgroep
Note: Centraal Boekhuis free classification field for publishers

Heading: Sender’s product category
Note: A product category (not a subject classification) assigned by the sender

Heading: GAPP Product Class
Note: Product classification maintained by the Chinese General Administration of Press and Publication (http://www.gapp.gov.cn)

Heading: CPA
Note: Statistical Classification of Products by Activity in the European Economic Community, see http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/ramon/nomenclatures/index.cfm?TargetUrl=LST_NOM_DTL&StrNom=CPA_2008. Use 6 digits, without punctuation. For example, printed children’s books are ‘58.11.13’, but the periods are normally ommited in ONIX

Heading: NCM
Note: Mercosur/Mercosul Common Nomenclature, based on the Harmonised System. Use 8 digits, without punctuation

Heading: CPV
Note: Common Procurement Vocabulary, uses to describe requirements for tender for public tendering and procurement within the EU. Code is a nine digit number (including the check digit). See http://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=URISERV:l22008

Heading: PKWiU
Note: Polish Classification of Products and Services (2015). Use a single letter followed by 2 to 7 digits, without punctuation. For use in ONIX 3.0 only

Heading: Electre genre
Note: Typologie de marché géré par Electre (Market segment code maintained by Electre)
